title: Download verifiable COVID-19 vaccination and test result records on iPod touch
description: On iPod touch, store verifiable COVID-19 vaccination and test result records in Health and verifiable COVID-19 vaccination records in Wallet.

- - - - [Copyright](https://support.apple.com/guide/ipod-touch/copyright-iph3e5c0810/ios) Download verifiable COVID-19 vaccination and test result records on iPod touch You can securely download verifiable COVID-19 vaccination and test result records and store them in the Health app . You can also add verifiable COVID-19 vaccination records to the Wallet app (iOS 15.1 or later). Use a QR code or a link to obtain a verifiable COVID-19 vaccination or test result record If your healthcare provider or authority makes a QR code or a link available to you, do one of the following: Use your iPod touch camera to [scan the QR code](https://support.apple.com/guide/ipod-touch/scan-a-qr-code-iphe8bda8762/15.0/ios/15.0). Tap the link. Do one of the following: Add a vaccination record to Wallet and Health: (iOS 15.1 or later) Tap Add to Wallet & Health, then tap Done. Add a test result to Health: Tap Add to Health, then tap Done. Automatically download verifiable COVID-19 vaccination and test result records If you [set up health record downloads](https://support.apple.com/guide/ipod-touch/download-health-records-iphe103f5a3e/15.0/ios/15.0) from a healthcare provider that supports verifiable health records and Health Records on iPhone, and you receive a COVID-19 vaccination or test from the provider, the record is automatically downloaded to Health. View a verifiable COVID-19 vaccination or test result record In Health, tap Browse at the bottom right of the screen. Scroll down, then tap Immunizations (for a vaccination) or Lab Results (for a test result). You can also view and present a vaccination record as a vaccination card in Wallet on your iPod touch. See [Use COVID-19 vaccination cards in Wallet on iPod touch](https://support.apple.com/guide/ipod-touch/use-covid-19-vaccination-cards-iph7f2865325/15.0/ios/15.0). Add a previously downloaded vaccination record to Wallet You may have a verifiable COVID-19 vaccination record in Health that doesn't appear in Wallet if you did either of the following: You [set up health record downloads](https://support.apple.com/guide/ipod-touch/download-health-records-iphe103f5a3e/15.0/ios/15.0)from a healthcare provider that supports verifiable health records and Health Records on iPhone, and you received your COVID-19 vaccination from the provider. You used a QR code or a link to obtain a verifiable COVID-19 vaccination record using a version of iOS earlier than iOS 15.1. To add this information as a vaccination card in Wallet, do the following: Tap Summary in Health (at the bottom left of the screen). Tap Add to Wallet (in an alert near the top of the screen).
